alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 4:22AM EDT until June 26 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin and Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Rumford, Jay, Dixfield, Canton, Andover, Mexico and Weld.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
